result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sage Gabrielle Powless

records.addlTxt:
8:17 AM Defendant Sage Gabrielle Powless appeared by phone.  Attorney Marcus M Zimmer appeared by video for Sage Gabrielle Powless.  Attorney David Meany appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.   Atty confirms there is a prelim hearing.  Back on the record at 8:22.  State calls witness Officer Christopher Pupp, sworn in, questioned.  Atty questions witness.  State makes argument.  Court finds PC that a crime was committed in Ashland County case is bound over for arraignment.  State filing information it mirrors charges in criminal complaint.  Atty, waives reading, pleads NG, noted.
Status conference scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on January 9, 2023 at 02:00 pm.

10:13 AM Defendant Sage Gabrielle Powless appeared by phone.  Attorney Marcus M Zimmer appeared by video for Sage Gabrielle Powless.  Attorney Ruth Diane Kressel appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Atty, have not had time to talk with def.  Atty and def placed in breakout room.  Back on the record at 10:19.  Atty, def recv'd complaint, waives reading, asking for prelim hearing within time limits.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 31, 2022 at 08:15 am.
State's Response to Defendant's Motion for Preliminary Examination Order
Notice of Defendant's Motion for Preliminary Examination Order

records.addlTxt:
10:15 AM Defendant Sage Gabrielle Powless appeared by phone.  Attorney Ralph David Imholte appeared by video for Sage Gabrielle Powless.  Attorney David Meany appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Atty, filed motion to withdraw, unsure if PD office is working on finding atty.  Motion is granted.  Def needs to contact PD office asap to find new atty.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.
ACJ Bond Payment Remit, Notice Regarding Posting Bond, BB Info from Jail & signed cash bond.

$75 pst'd, needs to pst addt'l $150
Def shall not possess or consume any mind-altering substances meaning alcoholic beverages, controlled substances, inhalants, synthetic marijuana, or similar substances and/or over the counter medications used contrary to label instructions, or prescription medications not taken in compliance with a prescription issued to the defendant.  Def is not to go into any place where mind altering substances are present, maintained, sold or consumed, except defendant may enter a convenience store or grocery store, even if alcohol is sold there. 
Def to have NO contact w/RF

Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
